review_title: I’m happy here. I matter here.
pros: From day one everyone has been helpful to me. Adjusting to a new culture and city has its challenges. But this is the first time I feel happy to be myself amongst my coworkers. My supervisors are patient and intelligent. I value that most. While I’m still learning my role, the mission of Thrive is dear to my heart. I love it here so far.
cons: None so far. I believe if I had any that they would be worked out in a fair way.

pros: You don’t work weekends so there’s that
cons: You have to take on billing and and coding work load, there’s zero communication between providers their MA’s and the lab, low moral, not paid nearly enough for the work load you’re always asked to do. Management and HR are a joke.
Very low pay, low morale, not really making any impact, no room for growth, no pay raises.

pros: Enjoy the pay. I Enjoyed working with and helping families
cons: Some downsides are working on weekends and having to learn new employees

pros: The general pool of workers are very friendly and easy to get along with
cons: You kind of have to create your own worth within the company.

job_title: Social Worker/Case Manager in Florence, AL
pros: Thrive Alabama is one of the best employers I have had. All the employees work together to provide the best care for our clients. Everyone is a team player and pitches in to assist when it is needed. The agency as a whole also provides and encourages staff to take time for self-care, in order to avoid burn out.
cons: The agency is growing rapidly and it is hard to keep up with all the new employees.

pros: Company pays for your insurance, THATS IT
cons: MANAGEMENT IS AWFUL!! Money hungry, only cares about their perfect reputation.  Does not care about their employees. Will throw anyone under the bus for management mess ups

pros: Great work environment, awesome benefits, flexible work schedule.

Free benefits
Hour lunch
Off on every holiday but have to use your personal time
cons:
Everything else.

Most Managers are not qualified and don't have no type of certification
